# IOWarp — Context Engineering for Autonomous AI Agents

> IOWarp is an NSF-funded open-source context engineering platform that enables autonomous AI agents to orchestrate petabyte-scale scientific discovery across climate, materials, genomics, and seismology domains.

## Identity

- **Project**: IOWarp
- **Software Platform**: CLIO (Context Layer for IO)
- **Tagline**: Context engineering for autonomous AI agents in scientific computing and HPC
- **Website**: https://iowarp.ai
- **License**: BSD 3-Clause
- **Funding**: NSF Award #2411318 ($5M, 2024–2029)

## Three-Layer Architecture

1. **Intelligence Layer — CLIO Agent**: Autonomous agents for scientific data management, multi-agent coordination, context reasoning
2. **Tooling Layer — CLIO Kit**: 15+ MCP servers with 150+ tools (HDF5, Slurm, Darshan, ParaView, etc.)
3. **Storage Layer — CLIO Core**: Four integrated context engines for multi-tier data orchestration from GPU HBM to tape

## Four Core Engines

- **CLIO Ingest** (Content Assimilation Engine): "The Way In" — ingests 14+ scientific formats (HDF5, NetCDF, Zarr, ROOT, FITS, PDB)
- **CLIO Transfer** (Content Transfer Engine): "The Mover" — ML-based predictive data movement across storage tiers
- **CLIO Explore** (Content Exploration Interface): "The Finder" — Natural language queries at petabyte scale
- **CLIO Plugin** (Platform Plugins Interface): "The Connector" — HPC scheduler, storage, and instrument integration

## Key Metrics

- 7.5x faster scientific workflows
- 2.6x DRAM reduction
- 20% faster than MPI-based tiered I/O
- 150+ agent tools via MCP
- 15+ specialized MCP servers
- 25+ peer-reviewed publications
- 2 Best Paper Awards (SC, HPDC)
- 1 US Patent
- $15M cumulative research funding
- Deployed at 3+ national labs (LLNL, ANL, NERSC)

## Key Technologies

- Model Context Protocol (MCP) for agent-tool communication
- Hermes: high-performance shared memory and IPC
- Chimaera: distributed task runtime
- MegaMmap: memory-mapped storage extension
- OMNI: universal scientific file format

## Scientific Domains

- **Climate Science**: CESM data analysis, El Niño prediction, anomaly detection
- **Materials Science**: LAMMPS molecular dynamics, 7.5x faster convergence
- **Genomics**: GenomIO, variant effect prediction
- **Seismology**: EarthScope, continental-scale sensor fusion

## Team

- Gnosis Research Center, Illinois Institute of Technology (Lead)
- University of Utah (Partner)
- The HDF Group (Partner)
- PI: Dr. Xian-He Sun (IEEE Fellow)
- Co-PI: Dr. Anthony Kougkas (Deputy Director, GRC)

- https://github.com/iowarp/iowarp — Core platform
- https://github.com/iowarp/clio-kit — MCP servers and agent tools
- https://github.com/iowarp/clio-agent — CLIO Agent framework
